evidence.text: First, defendants’ recent policies and actions violate the Administrative Procedure Act (APA).

extracted.value: Violation of the Administrative Procedure Act (APA)

evidence.text: Second, defendants’ policies and actions contravene Spending Clause and other separation-of-powers constraints and constitute ultra vires executive action.

extracted.value: Violation of the Spending Clause and separation-of-powers constraints (ultra vires executive action)

evidence.text: plaintiffs seek swift relief from this Court. The Court should set aside NIH’s unlawful blacklisting policies—and the actions taken to implement those policies—and compel the review of applications that the agency has unlawfully withheld.

plaintiffs seek swift relief from this Court. The Court should set aside NIH’s unlawful blacklisting policies—and the actions taken to implement those policies—and compel the review of applications that the agency has unlawfully withheld.
This action arises under U.S. Constitution; the APA, 5 U.S.C. §701 et seq.; the Public Health Service Act (PHSA), 42 U.S.C. §201 et seq.; and federal regulations governing NIH grants.

extracted.value: Administrative Procedure Act (APA), 5 U.S.C. §701 et seq.; Public Health Service Act (PHSA), 42 U.S.C. §201 et seq.; U.S. Constitution (Spending Clause, etc.)
